section: Affiliates who use this program to apply for credit cards for their own use are NOT in violation of this Agreement.
explanation: This statement contradicts the general understanding and intent of affiliate programs, which are designed to reward affiliates for referring new customers, not for personal use. This creates ambiguity about whether an affiliate can benefit directly from their own links without violating the spirit of the agreement.

section: Either Affiliate or Chase may terminate this Agreement at any time, with or without cause, by giving the other party written or e-mail notice of termination. At the time of termination, any links to Chases Website must be removed immediately. Affiliate will continue to receive Commission payments for all Approved Accounts placed during the term of this Agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Chase may terminate this Agreement if Affiliate does not comply with the terms and conditions herein.
explanation: The text states that either party can terminate the agreement at any time. However, it also states "Notwithstanding the foregoing, Chase may terminate this Agreement if Affiliate does not comply with the terms and conditions herein." which implies that Chase has an extra reason to terminate this agreement.

section: All use of Chase Marks by Affiliate is subject to the prior written approval of Chase.
explanation: This is a structural flaw in legal terms because this does not specify how long Chase has to respond. Chase could take 10 years and that would not be a reasonable time frame. Therefore, it is a structural flaw.
